title: {partner} Suggests a Date
description: {partner} looks up from what they're doing with a hopeful expression. 'Hey, I was thinking... want to go on a date tonight? Just us?'
partner_choices: Plan something elaborate and romantic
Suggest a low-key but meaningful outing
Offer to let you pick the activity

title: {partner} Checks On You
description: {partner} sits down next to you and takes your hand. 'Hey. How are you really doing? I've been wanting to ask.'
partner_choices: Listen intently and follow up with thoughtful questions
Share their own feelings to create mutual vulnerability
Offer practical help with whatever's bothering you

title: {partner} Has News
description: {partner} bursts into the room, barely containing themselves. 'Okay, okay, you have to hear this!' They're practically bouncing.
partner_choices: Build the suspense and tell the story dramatically
Blurt it out immediately, too excited to wait
Make you guess first, enjoying the anticipation

title: {partner} Wants to Talk
description: {partner} approaches you with a serious expression. 'Can we talk? I've been thinking about something and I need to say it.'
partner_choices: Be direct and honest, even if it's hard
Start with reassurance before diving in
Ask what you need first, to understand better

title: {partner} Reaches for You
description: {partner} crosses the room and wraps their arms around you from behind. No words, just holding you close.
partner_choices: Hold on tight and not let go
Turn around and kiss you properly
Sway gently, turning it into a slow dance

title: {partner} Has a Surprise
description: {partner} is being suspiciously secretive. They keep checking their phone and smiling. 'Clear your evening,' they say mysteriously.
partner_choices: Reveal the elaborate surprise they've planned
Keep up the mystery until the last second
Adjust plans based on your mood

title: {partner} Is Concerned
description: {partner} has been watching you with worried eyes. Finally, they speak up. 'I'm worried about you. You haven't seemed like yourself lately.'
partner_choices: Push gently for you to open up
Offer to take things off your plate
Just be present without pressure

title: {partner} Starts Something
description: {partner} has that mischievous glint in their eye. Before you know it, they've stolen your spot on the couch and are grinning at you defiantly.
partner_choices: Escalate into full playful war
Tackle them and reclaim your spot (with cuddles)
Pretend to be offended, badly hiding a smile

title: {partner} Opens Up
description: {partner} is quiet tonight, but not the comfortable kind. Finally, in a small voice: 'Can I tell you something I've never told anyone?'
partner_choices: Share something deep and real
Test the waters with something smaller first
Ask you to share something too, so it's mutual

title: {partner} Makes Food
description: You walk in to find {partner} in the kitchen, surrounded by ingredients. 'I'm making your favorite,' they announce. 'Sit. You're not allowed to help.'
partner_choices: Cook with full focus and love
Chat with you while cooking
Put on music and make it an experience

title: {partner} Has Your Back
description: Someone said something about you - not to your face, but {partner} heard. They come to you, protective energy radiating. 'I handled it. Nobody talks about you like that.'
partner_choices: Tell you exactly what they said to defend you
Downplay it - you don't need to worry about those people
Ask how you want to handle things going forward

title: {partner} Notices You
description: {partner} stops what they're doing and just... looks at you. 'You know what? You're really beautiful.' It's not a special occasion. They just wanted to say it.
partner_choices: Get specific about what they love about you
Get flustered and adorable about it
Follow up with an action, not just words

title: {partner} Wants Adventure
description: {partner} pulls up something on their phone, eyes bright. 'Look at this! We should totally do this. What do you think? Say yes!'
partner_choices: Dive into planning it together right now
Be flexible - adjust if you're hesitant
Get even more ambitious with the plan

title: {partner} Needs Time
description: {partner} is a little withdrawn today. They're not upset with you - they make that clear - they just need some time to process something.
partner_choices: Explain what they need clearly and kindly
Check in periodically but give space
Come back to you when they're ready with full presence

title: {partner} Remembers
description: {partner} brings you something small - a snack, a book, a trinket. 'You mentioned wanting this like three months ago. I finally found it.'
partner_choices: Watch your reaction with pure joy
Explain the whole journey of finding it
Act casual like it's no big deal (it is)

title: {partner} Dreams Out Loud
description: Late at night, {partner} starts talking about the future. 'Sometimes I think about where we'll be in five years. Ten years. Growing old together.'
partner_choices: Paint a vivid picture of your future together
Ask what you dream about for 'us'
Make a small promise about that future

title: {partner} Believes In You
description: You've been doubting yourself about something. {partner} sits you down. 'Hey. Look at me. You can do this. I've seen what you're capable of.'
partner_choices: Remind you of times you've succeeded
Offer to help you prepare or practice
Promise to be there no matter the outcome

title: {partner} Gets Silly
description: {partner} is in a MOOD today. They're making faces, doing bits, trying everything to make you laugh. They will not rest until you're smiling.
partner_choices: Go full commitment on the bit
Keep escalating until you both can't breathe
Give up and just hold you, laughing

title: {partner} Wants to Create
description: {partner} has supplies spread out on the table. 'Come make something with me. It doesn't have to be good. Let's just make something together.'
partner_choices: Focus on the process, not the result
Make it collaborative - one creation together
Turn it into a playful competition

title: {partner} Says Thank You
description: {partner} catches you at a quiet moment. 'I don't say this enough, but... thank you. For choosing me. For being here. For everything.'
partner_choices: Get specific about what they're grateful for
Get emotional and vulnerable about it
Follow words with a meaningful action
